result.execSummary:
The defendant Kaleb M. Arenz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kaleb M. Arenz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kaleb M. Arenz was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
All court obligations shall be paid directly to Clerk of Court. 
Court waives domestic abuse surcharge.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample. 
Defendant shall participate in counseling deemed appropriate by DOC.
Expungement granted under 973.015 after successful completion of probation without any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaleb M. Arenz

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kaleb M. Arenz in court.  Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Peter A. Bartelt in court for Kaleb M. Arenz. Per agreement, defendant will plead to Ct 1. State will move to dismiss Ct 2. State will recommend 1 year probation. Conditions of probation is to pay court costs, provide DNA sample, and to participate in counseling. Court reviews plea questionnaire and finds defendant freely and knowingly waives rights. Defendant plead guilty to Ct 1. Court accepts plea and finds defendant guilty of Ct 1. Ct 2 dismissed per agreement. State heard. Attorney Bartelt heard. State has no objection to expungement. Defendant does not wish to be heard on sentencing. Court heard and orders 1 year probation. Conditions of probation are to pay court costs, DNA, and to participate in counseling deemed appropriate by DOC. Defendant is eligible for expungement upon successful completion of probation Court waives domestic abuse surcharge.

Defendant Kaleb M. Arenz appeared in court, Attorney Peter A. Bartelt appeared in court for Kaleb M. Arenz, Attorney Anthony Joseph Pozorski Sr. appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Waives reading & stands mute. Not guilty pleas entered on his behalf. Bond to continue. Status and trial  weeks set.
Status conference scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 31, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADA Anthony Pozorski appears in person. Defendant appears by video from Grant County Jail. Court explains charges, penalties and right to counsel. Defendant referred to SPD. State requests signature bond. Bond set at $500 signature. Arraignment set.
